page.title: 01Abington Pigotts & Neighbour
page.content: The parish of Abington Pigotts occupies approximately 3/4 of the area parts of Littington Steeple and Guilden Morden and Shingy the remainder. Abington Pigotts contain some 37 houses a 12c church, a 15c manor house a 17th century pub and two farm steadings. A 14c. gate house at Down Hall is a rarity. Originlly entirely a farming community many of the cottages are gentrified and 10 of the houses have been built since 1950. the area is predominantly arable producing wheat, barley and a variety of break crops. About 50 acres of woodland are in small 5 acre or less blocks. Dutch Elm disease has decimated the predominant species to the detriment of the scenery. Replanting is in hand with mixed hardwoods, but the charcter
